editorial:" lawson claimed that David Price voted for the initial two-page bailout that would authorize Henry Paulson to use his discretion. but David Price reminded us of his actual voting record, including his vote against the initial plan. no: David Price voted both times for the Henry Paulson/bernanke . he voted aye on hr 3997 on september 29, and voted aye to concur with senate amendments to hr 1424 on october 2. finally, it is important to note that bb& t ceo John Allison wrote a letter to congress expressing his concerns about the administration's plan- it is designed to help the wall street and large money-center banks who used lobbying and deregulation to become too big to fail, "and does not address the fundamental issues facing our credit markets, or local banks. a. pdf of mr. John Allison 's letter is available here: web page addresses and e-mail addresses

and Anna Chakvetadze struggling for form, Shamil Tarpishchev had to call up world number 10 and beijing bronze medallist Vera Zvonareva , 56th-ranked Ekaterina Valeryevna Makarova and number 71 Elena Vesnina ." this is the best team we could assemble at the moment, Shamil Tarpishchev told reporters. world number seven Dinara Safina , who takes on italian Flavia Pennetta in the u.s. open quarter-finals in new york later on wednesday, said it made no sense for her to switch to clay for for one week in the middle of her regular hardcourt season. world number six Elena Dementieva is already through to the u.s. open semi-finals. both Elena Dementieva and Dinara Safina have the chance to replace Ana Ivanovic at the top of the world rankings by winning the final grand slam of the year and Shamil Tarpishchev would not jeopardise their chances. Elena Dementieva and Dinara Safina have a real chance to become world number one so we have to give them a break, "he said.

John McCain talked to her occasionally. but mr. John McCain 's advisers also described him as admiring of ms. Sarah Palin 's political skills. he was aware of the infighting, they said, but it is unclear how much he was inclined or able to stop it. the tensions and their increasingly public airing provide a revealing coda to the ill-fated John McCain-Sarah Palin ticket, hinting at the mounting turmoil of a campaign that was described even by many republicans as incoherent, negative and badly run.

enforce them, "she said." it's silly to say we don't have the money to enforce them when you actually can write a ticket and collect a fine. suddenly, there's money. rose said the problem is that such regulations carry criminal instead of civil penalties. as criminal misdemeanors, they wind up in crowded district courts, he said. with civil enforcement, rose said the county could use a hearing examiner and take the worst offenders to superior court. lachney agreed it doesn't make sense to criminalize violations of regulations that many people aren't aware they're violating. he favors targeting habitual offenders. Joyce McDonald said one problem with such regulations is that they're written by lawyers and bureaucrats. "she agreed some violators simply don't know the law. she would simplify the law and focus on habitual offenders. community plans: in addition to countywide zoning regulations, pierce
